page.title: 16GHOSTS IN RADCLIFFE
page.content: THE BRITISH TELECOM BUILDING IN RAILWAY STREET RADCLIFFE IS BUILT ON THE SITE OF THE FORMER COMMERCIAL HOTEL. THE PUB WAS DEMOLISHED IN 1972, AFTER STANDING FOR 123 YEARS. TEH ENGINEER IN CHARGE IN 1951 CLAIMED THAT HE NOTICED A SUDDEN DROP IN TEMPERATURE AND SAW AN INDISTINCT SHAPE RISE FROM THE FLOOR AND GROW UNTIL IT REACHED THE CEILING WHERE IT DISAPPEARED. FIVE MORE SIGHTINGS WERE RECORDED UP TO 1972 WHEN TWO SCHOOLBOYS CLAIMED THEY SAW A GREY MIST. IT WAS ONLY AFTERWARDS THAT THEY HEARD ABOUT THE GHOST. THE MIST WAS REPUTED TO BE THE GHOST OF A LARDLORD OF THE HOTEL WHO WAS MURDERED.A PORTRAIT OF A BEARDED MAN, THOUGHT TO BE THE LICENCEE,WAS ENGRAVED ON A WINDOW, WAS SAVED BEFORE DEMOLITION & IS IN THE MUSEUM.
